subject: RE: [junit] Cactus + JDeveloper
msgSnippet: Hi Gabriel, Yes, you should be able to use the Cactus framework in any IDE. In term of integration, it should work seamlessly with JUnit IDE integration (as a
messageBody:
Hi Gabriel,

Yes, you should be able to use the Cactus framework in any IDE. In term
of integration, it should work seamlessly with JUnit IDE integration (as
a Cactus test case is a JUnit test case).

You can check the Cactus IDE page on the Cactus web page which explains
how to use Cactus in some IDEs like JBuilder. Using it in JDeveloper
should be the same.

Have fun!
-Vincent

> -----Original Message-----
> From: belingueres <gaby@...> [mailto:gaby@...]
> Sent: 10 December 2002 13:01
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Cactus + JDeveloper
>
> Hi,
>
> Does anybody knows if the Cactus framework can be integrated (or at
> least used) within the JDeveloper 9.0.3 IDE?
>
> Any answers will be welcomed
>
> Regards,
> Gabriel
>
